references.reason: This paper introduced denoising diffusion probabilistic models, a class of generative models that has achieved state-of-the-art results in image synthesis and is central to the topic of the current paper.

references.paper_title: High-resolution image synthesis with latent diffusion models
references.reason: This work introduced Latent Diffusion Models (LDMs), which build upon denoising diffusion probabilistic models and are a key component of the image generation techniques discussed in the current paper, particularly for high-resolution synthesis.

references.paper_title: DreamBooth: Fine tuning text-to-image diffusion models for subject-driven generation
references.reason: This paper introduces DreamBooth, a technique for personalizing text-to-image diffusion models, which is a key aspect of the image protection problem addressed in the current paper.

references.paper_title: An image is worth one word: Personalizing text-to-image generation using textual inversion
references.reason: This paper introduced textual inversion, a method for personalizing text-to-image models that is relevant to the discussion of image protection techniques in the current paper.

references.paper_title: Mist: Towards improved adversarial examples for diffusion models
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant to the focus of the current work as it investigates methods for generating adversarial examples for diffusion models, a key element in developing image protection techniques.
